compounding.title: The Magic of Compounding
compounding.description: Learn how your money can grow exponentially over time through the power of compound interest.

concept.title: The Concept
concept.content: Imagine you have a money tree. Compound interest is like planting the seeds that fall from your tree, so they grow into new money trees.

coreIdea.title: The Core Idea
coreIdea.content: You earn interest on your money. Then, you earn *interest on your interest*. That's the magic.

interactive.title: See It In Action
interactive.content: Let's see it in action. Drag the slider to see how a R10,000 investment grows at 8% interest.

quiz.title: Quick Question
quiz.question: Which is more powerful for compounding?

emergencyFund.title: Emergency Funds Explained
emergencyFund.description: Why you need an emergency fund and how much to save before investing.

why.title: Why Bother?
why.content: Life happens‚Äîjob loss, car repairs, medical bills. An emergency fund keeps you from going into debt (or selling investments at the worst time).

howMuch.title: How Much?
howMuch.content: Common rule: 3‚Äì6 months of essential expenses. Start with a mini-goal (R5,000‚ÄìR10,000), then build up.

interactive.title: Your Target
interactive.content: Drag to set monthly essentials (rent, food, transport). We'll show you a 3‚Äì6 month emergency target.

quiz.title: Quick Check
quiz.question: Where should an emergency fund be kept?

firstPortfolio.title: Building Your First Portfolio
firstPortfolio.description: Create a diversified investment portfolio that matches your goals and risk tolerance.

goals.title: Start With Goals
goals.content: Timeline + purpose = allocation. Short-term goals ‚Üí safer assets. Long-term goals ‚Üí more growth assets.

diversify.title: Diversification
diversify.content: Mix asset classes (stocks, bonds, cash) and geographies so one loser doesn't sink the whole ship.

interactive.title: Try an Allocation
interactive.content: Move sliders for stocks/bonds/cash. See simulated volatility and long-term return change in real time.

quiz.title: Quick Check
quiz.question: What's the main benefit of diversification?

options.reduceRisk: Reduces risk from any single investment

riskReturn.title: Understanding Risk and Return
riskReturn.description: Discover the relationship between risk and potential rewards in investing.

intro.title: What is Risk?
intro.content: Risk is how much your investment can go up or down. Higher risk can mean higher gains ‚Äî but also bigger drops.

tradeoff.title: The Trade-off
tradeoff.content: Safer assets (like cash) have lower returns. Riskier assets (like stocks) can grow more over time but swing more.

interactive.title: Pick Your Path
interactive.content: Move the slider between "safe" and "risky" to see how volatility and long-term return might change.

options.A: Higher returns always mean less risk
options.B: Higher potential returns usually come with higher risk

taxEfficient.title: Tax-Efficient Investing
taxEfficient.description: Learn about tax-free / tax-advantaged accounts and smart placement to keep more of your returns.

wrappers.title: Use the Wrapper
wrappers.content: Tax-advantaged accounts like an RA, shield growth/dividends from some taxes.

placement.title: Asset Location
placement.content: Place tax-inefficient assets (e.g., bond funds, high dividend payers) in tax-sheltered accounts first.

interactive.title: Smart Placement
interactive.content: Drag funds into "Taxable" vs "Tax-Advantaged" buckets. See the estimated after-tax return improve.

quiz.title: Quick Check
quiz.question: Which move is generally MORE tax-efficient?

options.A: Holding bond funds in a tax-advantaged account
options.B: Holding bond funds in a taxable brokerage account
